activities: The Organization has a need to extract and compile the human resources data of its employees in the EU.  The use of EU employee personnel data by the Organization includes global enterprise headcount reporting, payroll, benefits administration, inter-company transfers and related transactions, relocation, expatriate administration, statistical analysis, compensation planning and related transactions, career development, staffing, international cross border management, performance management, monitor and track employee compliance with training requirements, international personal security issues, internal investigations, ethics and other investigations, law enforcement inquiries, U.S. government agency inquiries and mergers, acquisitions and divestures, audit, and systems access.

recoursemech: To ensure compliance with the Safe Harbor Principles, the Organization will:  (a) Cooperate with the Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) of the EU countries in the investigation and resolution of complaints and comply with advice given by DPAs; and (b) Periodically verify the Organization's compliance with the Safe Harbor Principles.  Textron conducts annual self-assessment reviews scheduled for August/September of each year.
